thread.title: Saina loses top ranking to world champion Marin
thread.title_full: Saina loses top ranking to world champion Marin

title: Saina loses top ranking to world champion Marin
text:
Saina loses top ranking to world champion Marin Saina loses top ranking to world champion Marin October 22, 2015 16:11 IST IMAGE: Spain's Carolina Marin (right) and India's Saina Nehwal (left) pose for photos during trophy presentation at the BWF World Championships in Jakarta. Photograph: Reuters 
E arly exits at Japan Open and Denmark Open proved costly for ace India shuttler Saina Nehwal as she lost her World No.1 crown to All England andWorld champion Carolina Marin of Spain. 
In the latest Badminton World Federation (BWF) ranking list released on Thursday, Saina dropped to No.2 spot in women's singles with 81782 points, 1630 points behind Marin, who reached the semifinals at Odense last week. 
After her World Championship final loss to Marin, Saina made second round exits in the next two tournaments -- Japan and Denmark -- following her straight game defeats against Japan's Minatsu Mitani. 
Two-time World Championship bronze medalist P V Sindhu, who reached her maiden Super Series final at Denmark Open, remained static at World No.13. 
In men's singles, Kidambi Srikanth, Parupalli Kashyap and H S Prannoy slipped down the rankings chart. While Srikanth lost a spot to be sixth, Commonwealth Games champion Kashyap slumped to No.10 from No. 8. 
Indonesia Masters winner Prannoy, who defeated two-time Olympic and five-time World Champion Lin Dan of China in the first round of French Open in Paris yesterday, lost a position to be No.17 but Ajay Jayaram climbed a place to be ranked World No.25. 
In men's doubles, Manu Attri and B Sumeeth Reddy, who reached the finals of Dutch Open Grand Prix, rose to No.19, while Jwala Gutta and Ashwini Ponnappa slipped a place to be at No.13 in women's doubles.
